intro: Dasymaschalon borneense, commonly known as the Bornean dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, palmately lobed leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
